description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

Hardware Operations (HWOps) deploys and maintains the hardware components of Google’s Compute, Storage, and Network infrastructure in the most efficient, reliable, secure, and scalable way. We are the team that manages Google’s IT infrastructure in the data centers globally by building and maintaining capacity on demand for all Google product areas.

As the Lead Program Manager of the Fleet Deployment Strategic Programs Office for Hardware Operations, you will program manage a team of Program Managers located at distributed Google data center locations, who oversee complex, multidisciplinary strategic projects with global footprints. You are the program leader in a very operational role, planning and monitoring a portfolio of transformational projects. You will gather plan short and long-term requirements with internal customers and partners at a leadership level, collaborating with hardware design, planning, supply chain, and logistics team leaders, and working with our data center Managers and Engineers to lead projects throughout their entire lifecycle.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 12 years of experience in program management.
  • Ability to travel up to 20% of the time.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 5 years of experience in management within a technology environment, with a background in data center operations and/or information security.
  • Experience in Supply Chain operations, with an understanding of materials scheduling, manufacturing, planning/forecasting processes, and logistics/delivery.
  • Experience as a people manager, with the ability to manage project involving cross-functional stakeholders across various regions.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent organizational, communication and analytical skills.
responsibilities:
• Manage a team of Program Managers to deliver or critical Hardware Operations initiatives related to fleet deployment.
  • Manage multiple, simultaneous, and complex technical projects from inception through to completion. Ensure requirements are complete and scope is well defined for your and your team’s projects.
  • Manage communication of progress/status with customer groups in various locations and timezones. Manage relationships between cross-functional teams.
  • Overcome challenges to keep processes running smoothly. Define and develop cross-team roles, expectations, and responsibilities and drive process development and iterative optimizations.
title: Lead Program Manager, Hardware Operations, Fleet Deployment Strategic Programs
